intro: Mengea, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant features showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white or pale pink petals. Mengea typically grows in open, sunny areas and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Its botanical structure includes a sturdy stem, narrow leaves, and a compact growth habit.
